Last Jedi 2nd viewing review (no spoilers) : I liked the movie in the same way I like fast food... I enjoy eating it but that does not mean is good nor healthy to eat it. Is this what we are suposed to expect from the Disney cinema experience? From big budget movies? Not worth the money.

Regarding the Hero\xb4s Journey
column80:
this movie fails every single aspect of it and that is why people won\xb4t care for it. The hype won\xb4t last more than a few months. Pure marketing stunt based on nostalgia and special effects.

I liked the movie but I also like Macdonalds (specially after so much time without having it ) but even so... after 30 minutes you are hungry again... it does not fulfill you
column81:
because it does not have real nutrients. Our pleasure comes from nostalgia alone.

Star Wars went from universal themes and an epic mythological story to politics and fake feminism.

If what you like is action
column82:
special effects and cheap comedy than this is the movie for you.

Kathleen Kennedy pissed on the fan base
column83:
Mark Hamill and the entire world with her distorted view on feminism. For the love of God fire this woman!

Clearly this is a producer film and not an art film. Money is the name of this game and artistic integrity is thrown out the window. I simply cannot believe Rian was in control of this movie.

My major complaints: ( SPOILER WARNING )

Did Luke hit Yoda when Yoda refused to train him? Is that what feminism is all about? Women beating men? Telling men what to do? Isn\xb4t the master\xb4s choice of whom he is willing to teach? Physicaly beating your own teacher because you disagree makes you surpass him? I sense the Dark Side in this movie.

I support real feminism by the way and Mary Sues are the antithesis of feminism. Just to name a few

column97: in a bad way off course. Very hard to explain but the tension in the air really showed that was not me really having a hard time with what we are seeing. No laughs

only the terrible silence of people trying to hide themselves in the chairs.

I will say very briefly that not only it was not what fans expected
column100: but rather is an important sign that we are tired of Hollywood and Media pushing modern agendas and dramas into what was supposed to be a Classic fantasy adventure
column101: with heroes and villains that for generations populated our imaginations and inspired us. Instead they are forcing more \'modern\' narratives
column102: where things are not light or dark but in between (grey). The problem here is that Star Wars was never that place and even if was the case could be better done
column103:
not going so far from its roots.

The future of Star Wars is very uncertain now that Disney really showed its cards and what to expect in the future. They are getting rid of the \'old stuff\' to have more room to expand
column104:
and doing so killing all the adventure that made the franchise so appealing.

This trilogy is pointless and will ruin the future of the Saga. It does not have heart
